intro: Agelanthus zizyphifolius subsp. zizyphifolius, commonly known as the Zizyphus-leaved Agelanthus, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape, with a glossy surface and a waxy coating. It produces yellowish-green capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds. This plant is native to parts of southern Africa and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils.
